summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, sent on December 17, 2018. The sender, who is a Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator, is preparing for a quarterly meeting to discuss human trafficking issues and anticipates questions about Jeffrey Epstein. The email seeks guidance on what specific points to convey about Epstein.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator, Violent & Organized Crime, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is preparing for a quarterly meeting on human trafficking issues and expects questions about Jeffrey Epstein. They are seeking guidance on what to convey.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email indicates that the recipient of the meeting ('She') may ask about Jeffrey Epstein in the context of human trafficking issues.

connections.description: The AUSA is preparing to discuss Epstein in an official meeting about human trafficking, indicating Epstein is a subject of interest or investigation by the SDNY's human trafficking coordination team.

events.title: Email regarding Epstein and human trafficking meeting
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an email seeking guidance on what to convey about Jeffrey Epstein in an upcoming quarterly meeting on human trafficking issues.

keyFacts: As of December 2018, Jeffrey Epstein was a topic of anticipated discussion in a quarterly meeting on human trafficking issues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney, who was a Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator, sought specific guidance on what to convey about Epstein beyond generalities.
The email indicates ongoing official interest in Epstein within the SDNY's Violent & Organized Crime section prior to his 2019 arrest.
